questions.correctAnswer: A fixed-size, ordered collection of elements of the same type.
questions.explanation: Arrays store data at contiguous memory locations and allow O(1) access by index.

questions.questionText: What is the time complexity to insert at the end of a dynamic array?
questions.explanation: Occasionally O(n) on resize, but most inserts are O(1).

questions.questionText: What is a string in most modern programming languages?
questions.correctAnswer: A sequence of characters stored as an array.
questions.explanation: Strings are commonly implemented as contiguous arrays of characters, sometimes immutable.
